creditline: Gift of Sue Y.S. Kimm and Seymour Grufferman
description: black form with texture at bottom; black woodgrain wedge, URC; white circle, grey teardrop, and yellow teardrop, ULC
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on embossed paper
signed:
Signed LRC: Haku Maki
Signed LRC: 巻白 {Maki Haku]
text: These three prints show how Maki explored different relationships among colors, shapes, and textures. The weathered, dark blue areas, like painted cement walls that have survived a few seasons, and the irregular woodgrain shapes both reference nature. By juxtaposing these with abstract, debossed teardrops, ovals, and circles, Maki emphasized the incongruity of the natural and constructed.
title: Poem - 11
